isis.stitle: CAB: 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 AND 8600 MODELS - ADJUSTMENTS - CAB AIR SUSPENSION

svcsubproc.title: Cab Air Suspension for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 8500 Day Cab and Extended Cab Models
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 220 for Items in parentheses.

Check cab ride height between bottom of cab mounting plate (Item 1) and top of crossmember mounting plate (Item 2) of cab air suspension system. Cab air suspension air spring (bag) design height dimension A is 4.76 inches (120.9 mm).

To adjust cab ride height, measure cab ride height between jounce bumper strike plate (Item 3) and jounce bumper rate cup (Item 4), measurement must be made between measuring points (Item 7). If dimension does not meet specified height of 1.5 inches (38 mm) for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 8500 Day Cab and Extended Cab Models, adjust as necessary using the following procedure.

figure.caption: Figure 220. Cab Air Suspension for 7300, 7400, 7500 AND 8500 Day Cab and Extended Cab Models and 7300 AND 7400 Crew Cab Models

warning.para: To avoid property damage or personal injury, park the vehicle on a level surface, set the parking brake, chock the wheels, and turn the engine off.

step1.para: Apply parking brake and chock wheels.
Charge the air system to operating pressure of 90 to 110 psi.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 220 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Measure cab ride height between jounce bumper strike plate (Item 3) and jounce bumper rate cup (Item 4), measurement must be made between measuring points (Item 7) and must meet specified height of 1.5 inches (38 mm) for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 8500 Day Cab and Extended Cab Models.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 221 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: To adjust height control valve (Item 1), loosen the jam nut (Item 2) on the height control valve linkage (Item 3) and back off the nut several turns.
Unlatch the linkage socket clip (Item 4) and pry the linkage socket (Item 5) from the pivot ball.
Turn the linkage socket (Item 5) clockwise to shorten height control valve linkage or turn linkage socket counter clockwise to lengthen height control valve linkage.

caution.para: To avoid product damage, there must be a minimum of five (5) full threads between the threaded rod and the linkage socket. To maintain the required minimum thread requirement, it may be necessary to loosen the jam nut at the other end of the height control valve linkage and turn linkage socket at that end to obtain the required adjustment.

step1.para: Attach the linkage socket (Item 5) back onto the pivot ball, re-measure the cab ride height, and adjust as required.
When proper adjustment is achieved (1.5 inches (38 mm) for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 8500 Day Cab and Extended Cab Models), latch linkage socket clip (Item 4) and tighten jam nut (Item 2).
Remove wheel chocks from wheels.

figure.caption: Figure 221. Cab Air Suspension Height Control Valve Adjustment
